intro: Cabucala erythrocarpa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf red-fruited cabucala, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its unique fruit structure and ornamental foliage make it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
